availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Conrad Viehmann (Campbell County, Kentucky, rag picker.)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, rag picker. Native of Saxony. Married to Christina Ghoepp Viehmann. Father of Henry Viehmann, Conrad Viehmann, Christie Viehmann, and John Viehmann. Resident of Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1862. Convicted of selling liquor to minors in Campbell County in 1862. Rag picker in Campbell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 391A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Campbell County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 243.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 21404.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Campbell County Wills, vol. 1-2, 1863-1887, p. 532.
"Mayor's Court," Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), January 2, 1862, p. 3.
"Circuit Court," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), February 9, 1862, p. 5.
KYR-0001-029-0091.
